name: Nym
description: A decentralized mixnet infrastructure providing network-level privacy against sophisticated end-to-end attackers. Uses Sphinx packet format for anonymous communication and Coconut blinded, re-randomizable credentials for anonymous transactions. Built on the Loopix academic research foundation with economic incentives via the NYM token.

team.name: Harry Halpin
team.background: Former Senior Research Scientist at MIT, led standardization of Web Cryptography API at W3C under Tim Berners-Lee, former Inria de Paris researcher. PhD in Informatics and Philosophy from University of Edinburgh.

team.name: Claudia Diaz
team.background: Associate Professor at KU Leuven COSIC research group, 60+ publications with 4,000+ citations, Program Chair of Privacy Enhancing Technologies Symposium. PhD in Engineering, Computer Security, and Privacy from KU Leuven.

team.name: Mark Sinclair
team.background: Serial entrepreneur in healthcare and security sectors. PhD in Computer Vision and Image Processing from University of Edinburgh. 474+ commits to main repository.

team.name: Ania Piotrowska
team.background: Designer of Loopix mixnet (Nym's academic foundation), PhD under George Danezis at UCL. Expert in onion routing and mix networks.

team.name: Alexis Roussel
team.background: Founded Bity (Swiss cryptocurrency brokerage), led Swiss Pirate Party. Master's in Law from Sorbonne University Paris.

team.name: Jaya Klara Brekke
team.background: PhD in Digital Geography from Durham University. Leads ecosystem development, operators, community, and communications.

team.name: Marc Debizet
team.background: Former Head of Retail Payments and Expansion at Revolut. Engineering graduate from Columbia University and Ecole Polytechnique.

team.name: George Danezis
team.background: Professor at UCL, co-founder of Chainspace (acquired by Facebook/Libra), now Chief Scientist at Mysten Labs. PhD supervisor of Ania Piotrowska.

team.name: Aggelos Kiayias
team.background: Chair in Cybersecurity and Privacy at University of Edinburgh, Chief Scientist at Input Output (Cardano). Project Coordinator of PANORAMIX. BCS Lovelace Medal recipient.

team.name: Ben Laurie
team.background: Principal Engineer at Google, founding member of Apache Software Foundation, creator of Apache-SSL, core team member of OpenSSL. Levchin Prize recipient.
